marklogic.body: Â There was talk of Gino going to the NWA in 86. I think if Gino had lived, he would have been the one to take Ole's place. Like Tully, the guy could draw Heat!!..Been following wrestling since the early 80's... I laugh at some of the comments that others put on here. One thing I would not do is argue relentlessly like some do on here(name calling etc.)....Lex Luger was still green when he took Ole's Spot. Gino was a polished product, who would have fit in like a glove. I actually visited Gino's grave earlier this year, since I now live in Houston, TX. So sad he died at 29, just as his career was about to take Off... I miss the old territories :(
